decks.notes: The deck focuses on maximizing card advantage and control through efficient counter spells, removal, and card draw. It utilizes powerful artifacts like Time Vault and Mishra's Bauble in combination with Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion to maintain a steady stream of resources. The deck aims to disrupt opponents' strategies while setting up win conditions with cards like Time Walk and Dig Through Time. It also includes versatile cards like Force of Will and Demonic Tutor to adapt to different matchups and outmaneuver opponents.

The deck focuses on generating card advantage and mana through artifacts and spells, with the goal of assembling a powerful combo involving Paradoxical Outcome. By utilizing cards like Tinker and Time Vault, along with key pieces like Lavinia and Force of Will for disruption, the deck can quickly set up a winning board state or lock down the opponent's options. The inclusion of powerful tutor effects like Demonic Tutor and Mystical Tutor allows for flexible gameplay and consistency in executing the combo. Overall, the deck aims to outpace and outmaneuver opponents through its efficient card selection and mana acceleration.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on disruption, card advantage, and mana denial while utilizing the power of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion. The deck includes powerful spells like Ancestral Recall, Force of Will, and Demonic Tutor to control the board and find key pieces. Additionally, the deck features efficient mana acceleration with Moxen and a variety of counterspells and removal spells to control the opponent's threats. The inclusion of Urza's Saga and Orcish Bowmasters provides additional utility and threats to close out games.

This deck is focused on setting up and executing the Doomsday combo quickly and efficiently. It includes essential pieces like Dark Ritual for mana acceleration, Preordain and Ponder for card selection, and Thassa's Oracle as the win condition. The deck also has disruption in the form of Force of Will and Flusterstorm to protect the combo. The inclusion of powerful tutors like Demonic Tutor and Vampiric Tutor help find key combo pieces, while cards like Ancestral Recall and Time Walk provide additional card advantage and tempo advantage. The goal is to assemble the combo and win the game within a few turns.

This deck aims to disrupt opponents' strategies while aggressively deploying threats to control the game. It utilizes cards like Collector Ouphe and Force of Will to disrupt opponents, while deploying powerful threats like Tarmogoyf and Oko, Thief of Crowns to apply pressure. It also has access to powerful spells like Ancestral Recall and Demonic Tutor for card advantage and flexibility. The deck's mana base is optimized for consistency and can also disrupt opponents' mana base with cards like Wasteland and Strip Mine. Leovold, Emissary of Trest also provides additional disruption and card advantage.

The main focus of this Vintage 1 vs 1 Combo - Dredge deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with cards like Golgari Grave-Troll, Golgari Thug, and Stinkweed Imp, then bring back powerful creatures like Shambling Shell and Prized Amalgam using graveyard recursion effects like Noxious Revival. By utilizing cards like Bazaar of Baghdad and Serum Powder to filter through the deck, the deck aims to consistently bring back creatures and utilize their triggered abilities to overwhelm the opponent and win the game with explosive plays.

The deck focuses on using Oath of Druids to cheat out powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Atraxa, Grand Unifier quickly. It includes cards like Show and Tell and Bolas's Citadel to aid in getting these creatures onto the battlefield. The deck also includes control elements such as Force of Will and Oko, Thief of Crowns to disrupt the opponent's game plan and protect its own strategy. Overall, the deck aims to win through powerful creature threats and efficient control elements in a 1 vs 1 format.

The deck is built around utilizing artifacts and mana acceleration to generate massive card advantage and combo off with cards like Paradoxical Outcome and Mishra's Workshop. The goal is to quickly assemble a powerful board state with artifacts like The One Ring, Grim Monolith, and Coveted Jewel, while using cards like Tinker and Karn, the Great Creator to tutor for specific combo pieces like Time Vault and Manifold Key. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful artifact synergy and card advantage to secure a fast victory.

This deck utilizes the Dredge mechanic to quickly fill the graveyard and bring back powerful creatures like Prized Amalgam and Ichorid. By combining cards like Creeping Chill and Golgari Grave-Troll with Bazaar of Baghdad, the deck can generate a significant advantage over opponents. With multiple ways to protect its game plan, such as Force of Will and Force of Negation, the deck is able to disrupt opponents while assembling its combo pieces. Overall, the strategy revolves around quickly filling the graveyard and overwhelming the opponent with powerful creatures and disruptive spells.

The deck focuses on utilizing hatebears and aggro tactics to disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with efficient creatures. The inclusion of cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Chancellor of the Annex slows down the opponent's spells, while cards like Archon of Emeria and Anointed Peacekeeper prevent them from developing their board. The deck also uses powerful artifacts like Moxen and Chalice of the Void to accelerate its own game plan. Overall, the deck aims to control the game through disruption and aggression.

The main concept of this deck is to consistently and aggressively fill up your graveyard with Dredge cards like Golgari Grave-Troll and Stinkweed Imp to trigger powerful effects such as Prized Amalgam and Creeping Chill. By using cards like Bazaar of Baghdad and Serum Powder, you can quickly cycle through your deck to find your combo pieces. Additionally, using cards like Force of Will and Force of Negation can help protect your key pieces from being disrupted. The deck aims to overwhelm your opponent with a fast and efficient graveyard-based strategy.

This deck focuses on using various control elements such as counterspells, removal, and disruptive creatures to dominate the game and outvalue the opponent. It utilizes powerful cards like Time Walk, Ancestral Recall, and Urza's Saga to generate advantage and stay ahead in the game. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for recursion and flexibility in the late game. With a strong mana base and a mix of powerful spells and disruptive elements, this Dimir Control deck aims to control the game and outsmart the opponent to achieve victory.

The deck aims to disrupt opponent's game plan by using hatebears like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Chancellor of the Annex, while also applying pressure through aggro creatures like Archon of Emeria. It utilizes powerful mana acceleration from Moxen and Sol lands like Ancient Tomb to speed up its game plan. The deck also utilizes disruptive artifacts like Chalice of the Void and Trinisphere to further hinder the opponent's strategy. Overall, the deck aims to control the game with disruptive creatures and lock pieces while aggressively attacking the opponent's life total.

The deck focuses on using powerful artifacts and lands to create a disruptive and aggressive strategy. By utilizing cards such as Mishra's Workshop, Sphere of Resistance, and Trinisphere, the deck aims to slow down the opponent while efficiently deploying threats like Golos, Tireless Pilgrim and Lodestone Golem. Crucible of Worlds and Wasteland provide additional disruption, and Mystic Forge allows for card advantage and synergy with artifacts. The deck's reliance on artifacts and its disruptive elements set it apart as a unique and potent Aggro - MUD archetype in the Vintage 1 vs 1 format.

The deck focuses on playing aggressively with hatebears to disrupt the opponent's strategy while also utilizing powerful artifacts like Black Lotus and Moxen to ramp and control the board. The combination of hatebears like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Chancellor of the Annex with disruptive spells like Chalice of the Void and Trinisphere creates a challenging environment for the opponent to navigate. The inclusion of cards like Emeria's Call and Karakas provide additional utility and protection, creating a well-rounded aggro-hatebear strategy in a Vintage 1 vs 1 format.

This Dimir Control deck aims to disrupt opponent's plays with counterspells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce while utilizing cards like Brainstorm and Dig Through Time to find answers and threats. The inclusion of Lurrus as a Companion allows for recurring value from the graveyard. Urza's Saga provides additional utility and card advantage while cards like Wasteland and Strip Mine keep opponent's resources in check. The deck also features a mix of mana acceleration with Moxen and disruption with permanent removal like Soul-Guide Lantern. Overall, the deck is designed to control the game and outvalue opponents in the long run.
